question_text: In Kenneth Pomeranz's 'The Great Divergence,' what two factors does he identify as critical for explaining why Britain industrialized ahead of China's Yangtze Delta after 1800?
correct_answer: Access to coal deposits and New World colonial resources
distractors: Superior scientific institutions and Protestant work ethic
Maritime military dominance and banking innovations
Democratic governance and patent law protections

question_text: The Asante Empire was unified under Osei Tutu I around 1701 through a sacred symbol said to have been conjured from the sky by priest Okomfo Anokye. What was this unifying object?
correct_answer: The Golden Stool (Sika 'dwa), believed to embody the soul of the Asante nation
distractors: The Ivory Crown of Kumasi, symbolizing royal lineage
The Iron Sword of Denkyira, representing military conquest
The Sacred Drum of Obuasi, signifying ancestral authority

question_text: Jayavarman VII, considered the greatest Khmer king, built the walled city of Angkor Thom after expelling which foreign invaders who had sacked Angkor in 1177?
correct_answer: The Chams, from the kingdom of Champa
distractors: The Siamese, from the Ayutthaya Kingdom
The Dai Viet forces from northern Vietnam
The Srivijayan navy from Sumatra

question_text: Great Zimbabwe, the largest stone structure in precolonial Southern Africa, derived much of its wealth from controlling trade routes connecting inland goldfields to which coastal trading network?
correct_answer: The Indian Ocean trade via Swahili coast ports such as Sofala
distractors: The trans-Saharan caravan routes through Timbuktu
The Atlantic coastal trade managed by Portuguese merchants
The Red Sea trade network through Ethiopian port cities

question_text: Andre Gunder Frank's dependency theory argues that peripheral nations experience their greatest economic development under which historical condition?
correct_answer: When their ties to core metropolitan countries are weakest
distractors: When they receive the highest levels of foreign direct investment
When they adopt free-trade agreements with developed nations
When international commodity prices reach their peak

distractors: The conjoncture (medium-term cyclical trends)
The histoire événementielle (short-term event history)

distractors: The Canary Islands
